How to Read Picks

Understanding Our Rating Scale

Our system uses a clear, easy-to-understand scale to communicate the strength of each stock pick. Higher scores mean more indicators are aligned in favor of the trade.

EXTREMELY STRONG BUY
Score: 95-100
Exceptional setup with multiple confirming signals. Highest conviction pick. Rare occurrence.
Consider larger position (up to 5% of portfolio)
STRONG BUY
Score: 80-94
Very good setup with most indicators aligned. High confidence in potential upside.
Standard position (3-4% of portfolio)
BUY
Score: 65-79
Good opportunity with solid technical or fundamental signals. Worth considering.
Smaller position (2-3% of portfolio)
HOLD
Score: 50-64
Neutral outlook. Not a new buy, but don't sell if you already own it.
No new action recommended
SELL
Score: 35-49
Weakening signals detected. Consider reducing or exiting positions.
Reduce or exit position
STRONG SELL
Score: Below 35
Significant weakness detected. Multiple negative signals present.
Exit position recommended

Beginner-Friendly Glossary

New to investing? Here's what all these terms mean in plain English. Click any category to expand.

üìà Chart & Trend Terms
Trend
The general direction a stock is moving. Uptrend = going up. Downtrend = going down. Sideways = stuck in a range.
Moving Average (SMA)
The average price over a set number of days. Example: 200 SMA = average price over the last 200 days. Used to judge long-term trend direction.
50 SMA & 200 SMA
Very common trend benchmarks. Price above 200 SMA = long-term bull trend (good). Price below 200 SMA = long-term weakness.
Stage-2 Uptrend
A stock in the "best growth phase": price rising, trading above its moving averages, and institutions are buying. This is when breakout stocks thrive.
Support
A price level where buyers tend to step in and stop the decline. Think of it as a "floor" under the stock price.
Resistance
A price level where sellers tend to appear and stop the rise. Think of it as a "ceiling" above the stock price.
Breakout
When a stock breaks above resistance (smashes through the ceiling). This often signals a big move is starting. We look for these!
üî• Momentum Indicators
Momentum
Speed of price movement. Momentum stocks rise quickly because buyers are aggressive. "Riding momentum" means following the direction of the crowd.
RSI (Relative Strength Index)
Measures if a stock is overbought or oversold. Scale: 0-100. RSI below 30 = oversold (potentially cheap). RSI 50-75 = bullish momentum. RSI above 80 = overheated (be careful).
Awesome Oscillator (AO)
Momentum shift detector. AO above 0 = buyers gaining control. AO below 0 = sellers are stronger. We look for AO crossing above zero.
ADX (Average Directional Index)
Measures how STRONG a trend is (not its direction). ADX below 20 = weak/no trend. ADX above 25 = strong trend. ADX above 40 = extremely powerful trend.
üìä Volume & Institutional Terms
Volume
How many shares were traded. High volume = strong interest from buyers and sellers. Low volume = not much activity.
Volume Surge / Spike
Trading activity far above normal (e.g., 2x or 3x average). Usually means big buyers are entering or there's news/breakout happening.
Volume Z-Score
Measures how statistically unusual volume is. 3.0+ = huge spike (very unusual activity). We flag these as potential opportunities.
Institutional Footprint
Evidence that hedge funds, mutual funds, or banks are buying. They move markets because they buy in large quantities.
VWAP (Volume Weighted Average Price)
A benchmark price that professional traders use. Price above VWAP = institutions likely accumulating (good sign).
üìâ Volatility & Pattern Terms
Volatility
How much a stock swings up and down. High volatility = risky but potentially faster gains. Low volatility = more stable but slower moves.
Bollinger Bands
Bands drawn around the price showing the expected movement range. When price touches the upper band, the stock may be overextended.
Bollinger Squeeze
When the bands tighten close together, meaning volatility is compressed. Like a coiled spring - a breakout is likely coming soon!
VCP (Volatility Contraction Pattern)
A famous pattern from trader Mark Minervini. The stock becomes quieter, volatility tightens, then a big move often follows. Seen before explosive breakouts.
ATR (Average True Range)
Measures typical daily price movement. We use this to set appropriate stop-losses. Higher ATR = more volatile stock = wider stop needed.
Golden Cross
Bullish signal where the short-term moving average crosses above the long-term average (e.g., 50 SMA crosses above 200 SMA). Often signals a trend reversal upward.
‚ö†Ô∏è Risk & Trade Management
Stop Loss
A pre-set exit point to prevent large losses. Example: Buy at $86, set stop at $82. If it drops to $82, you sell immediately to limit your loss. Always use stop losses!
Take Profit / Target
A pre-set price where you sell to lock in your gains. Example: Buy at $86, target at $95. When it hits $95, you sell and take your profit.
Risk/Reward Ratio (R:R)
Compares potential profit to potential loss. 2:1 R:R means you could gain $2 for every $1 you risk. We aim for 2:1 or better on all picks.
Slippage
The real price you get may be slightly worse than expected due to market movement. We add +0.5% to entry prices to account for this.
Position Sizing
How much money to put in each trade. Rule of thumb: Never risk more than 2-5% of your total portfolio on one trade. This protects you from catastrophic losses.
üåç Market Environment
Market Regime
The overall market environment. Bull Market = rising prices, optimism. Bear Market = falling prices, fear. Neutral = sideways, uncertain.
Bull Market
When the overall market is rising. Momentum strategies work best. Most stocks go up with the tide. "Bulls" profit when prices go up.
Bear Market
When the overall market is falling. Defensive and value strategies work best. Cash is often king. "Bears" profit when prices go down.
SPY
An ETF that tracks the S&P 500 (500 largest US companies). Used as a benchmark for overall market health. If SPY is up, the market is generally bullish.
üìÖ Holding Styles & Timeframes
Day Trade
Hold for less than 24 hours. Buy and sell within the same day. Requires constant monitoring. High frequency, high stress.
Swing Trade
Hold for 3-7 days. Capture short-term price swings. Most active trading style. Check positions daily but not constantly.
Position Trade
Hold for 1-4 weeks. Hold through a specific move or pattern completion. Less monitoring needed than swing trading.
Investment
Hold for 1+ months. Buy and hold for longer-term growth. Check weekly or monthly. Less stressful, requires patience.
Long Position
You profit when the stock goes UP. This is the standard way to invest. All our picks are LONG positions.
üß¨ Our Algorithms Explained
Alpha Predator
Our flagship algorithm. Combines trend strength (ADX) + momentum (AO) + pattern (VCP) + institutional activity (VWAP) to find stocks with multiple confirming signals.
Technical Momentum
Finds stocks with volume surges, RSI momentum, and breakout patterns. Best for short-term momentum plays (24 hours to 7 days).
CAN SLIM
Based on William O'Neil's famous growth investing system. Focuses on stocks in Stage-2 uptrends with strong relative strength.
Composite Rating
Balanced scoring of technical + fundamental factors. Good for general watchlist building. Hold time: 1-3 months.
Penny Sniper
Hunts for microcap breakouts with extreme volume in penny stocks ($0.50-$15). Very high risk, very high reward potential.
Value Sleeper
Finds undervalued stocks near 52-week lows with solid fundamentals. For patient value investors. Hold time: 3+ months.

Beginner Quick Reference - Focus on These First

RSI Tells you if momentum is with you or against you
200 SMA Shows the long-term trend direction
Breakout When big moves begin - key entry signal
Volume Spike Confirms real buying interest
Stop Loss Protects you from big losses - ALWAYS USE
Risk/Reward Only take trades where reward exceeds risk

How Our System Works

Six algorithms analyze 101 stocks daily. Each algorithm is designed for different market conditions and investor styles.

Alpha Predator

Most Active

Our flagship algorithm combining trend strength, momentum, and pattern recognition with institutional activity detection.

Hold Time: 3-7 days
Best For: Stocks with multiple confirming signals
Key Indicators: ADX, AO, VCP, VWAP

Technical Momentum

Multi-Timeframe

Captures short-term momentum using volume surges, RSI signals, breakout patterns, and Bollinger Band analysis.

Hold Time: 24h / 3d / 7d
Best For: Short-term momentum plays

CAN SLIM

Growth

Based on William O'Neil's proven methodology. Focuses on relative strength, Stage-2 uptrends, and institutional buying.

Hold Time: 3-12 months
Best For: Growth stocks, $10+

Composite Rating

Balanced

Multi-factor approach combining technical signals with fundamental data and market regime awareness.

Hold Time: 1-3 months
Best For: General watchlist building

Which Picks Are Right for You?

Small Budget ($500-$5,000)

  • Focus on STRONG BUY with Medium Risk
  • Hold 3-5 positions maximum
  • Prefer 1-month timeframes (less monitoring)
  • Avoid penny stocks and high volatility
  • Keep 20% in cash for opportunities
Today's Best Fit: SBUX, PFE

Medium Budget ($5,000-$50,000)

  • Diversify across 6-10 positions
  • Mix of timeframes is OK
  • Can include swing trades (3-7 days)
  • Limit any single position to 15%
  • Keep 15% in cash
Today's Best Fit: GM, VTRS, WMT, CAT

Large Budget ($50,000+)

  • Hold 12-20 positions
  • Sector diversification required
  • Can allocate small % to higher risk
  • Position sizes 5-7% max
  • Keep 10% in cash
Today's Best Fit: Full portfolio from picks
